meanings.definition: Modest and reserved in manner or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She was the demurest girl in the room, always keeping to herself.
meanings.sent2: The demurest student in the class never sought attention.
meanings.sent3: At the party, her demurest behavior made her stand out in a sea of loud guests.
meanings.sent4: The demurest flower in the garden bloomed quietly, unnoticed by many.
meanings.sent5: Her demurest smile captured everyone's hearts with its gentle charm.

meanings.sent1: He gave a demurest nod when complimented on his work.
meanings.sent2: The demurest child blushed when praised for her drawing.
meanings.sent3: The demurest puppy hid behind its owner's legs when meeting new people.
meanings.sent4: In the demurest way, she declined the spotlight and preferred the shadows.
meanings.sent5: With the demurest gesture, he offered his seat to the elderly lady.

meanings.definition: Characterized by or suggesting modesty and shyness.
meanings.sent1: Her demurest outfit consisted of a simple dress and minimal accessories.
meanings.sent2: The demurest tone in her voice revealed her nervousness.
meanings.sent3: In the demurest manner, he excused himself from the conversation.
meanings.sent4: The demurest painting in the gallery spoke volumes without saying a word.
meanings.sent5: With the demurest of gestures, she accepted the award gracefully.
